intro: Sida cleisocalyx, commonly known as the narrowleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Sida cleisocalyx is an annual herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
